official-title.#text:
To authorize the use of United States Armed Forces against the terrorist organization Islamic State
			 of Iraq and the Levant (

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following joint resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against ISIL Resolution

short-title.#text: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against ISIL

text.#text: This joint resolution may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorization for use of United States Armed Forces

text.#text:
The President is authorized to use the Armed Forces of the United States against the Islamic State
			 of Iraq and the Levant (

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be confined to the territory of the Republic of Iraq
			 and the Syrian Arab Republic. The limitation of this subsection shall not
			 apply to the Armed Forces of the United States engaged in training of
			 indigenous Syrian or regional military forces for the purpose of combating
			 ISIL.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against ISIL Resolution/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: The authority granted in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
does not include the authority for the deployment of ground
			 forces in a combat role. For purposes of this subsection,
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against ISIL Resolution/s:2/ss:a

quote.#tail:
does not include special operations forces or other forces that may be deployed in a training,
			 advisory, or intelligence capacity.
quote.#text: ground forces in a combat role

text.#text: The authority granted in

header.#text: No authorization for use of ground forces in combat

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall terminate on the date that is 18 months after the
			 date of the enactment of this joint resolution.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against ISIL Resolution/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: The authority granted in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 8(a)(1) of the War Powers Resolution
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: War Powers Resolution/s:8/ss:a/p:1

declares that this
			 section is intended to constitute specific statutory authorization within
			 the meaning of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 5(b) of the War Powers Resolution
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: War Powers Resolution/s:5/ss:b

text.#text: Consistent with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: War Powers Resolution

text.#text: Nothing in this joint resolution supersedes any requirement of the

header.#text: Repeal of prior authorizations for use of United States Armed Forces

text.#text: The following provisions of law are hereby repealed:
The

text.#text: To the extent that the submission of any report required in
Whereas for months Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (

Whereas ISIL has brought under its control large areas of Iraq and Syria and announced on June 29,
			 2014, the establishment of a new caliphate;

Whereas in its conduct of military operations, its treatment of personnel captured on the
			 battlefield, and its behavior towards civilians in areas under its
			 control, ISIL has shown a level of brutality and depravity that shocks the
			 conscience;

Whereas ISIL brutally murdered two American journalists and a British aid worker and has threatened
			 the lives of other western hostages;

Whereas the rise of ISIL, the continuing threat posed by al Qaeda, and the pending redeployment of
			 United States combat troops from Afghanistan highlight the need to
			 re-examine and harmonize the legal authorities under which the President
			 is authorized to take offensive military action; and

Whereas the President has authority under the Constitution to take action to protect the United
			 States and its citizens from imminent threat or attack but Congress alone
			 holds the power to declare war: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HJ 125 IH: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against ISIL
